title: Inflation Data Fuels Climb in Short-Term Treasury Yields
sub_head: Yield on two-year Treasury note, which often rises when investors anticipate tighter central-bank policies, rose back toward highs for the year
body:
Yields on shorter-term U.S. government bonds rose after data showed inflation reached a 30-year high in October, reflecting investorsâ€™ expectations that the Federal Reserve will have to raise interest rates more quickly to combat surging consumer prices.
The yield on the two-year Treasury note, which often climbs when investors anticipate tighter central-bank policies, posted its largest one-day gain since March 2020, rising to 0.503%, near its highs for the year, according to Tradeweb.
